main event: A white light was observed in the western sky moving up and to the left for 1-2 minutes in Brockton, Massachusetts in 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed visually through an open window and appeared smaller than a star.
It moved rapidly and evenly, covering about 10 degrees of arc in 1-2 minutes with no sound heard.
The report suggests that no further investigation was conducted because it was possibly an aircraft, balloon, satellite, or it could not be located, ultimately leaving the object unidentified.
The sighting duration was relatively short, indicating a brief yet significant event.
The sighting occurred in the western sky, indicating a specific direction of movement for the observed object.
sighted object: a white light in the western sky
